title: Add footer social handles and async customer service chat (support inbox)

requirements.text: Update the site footer to display contact/social handles for Twitter/X and OpenChat using the handle “@RadicalEconomist101”, placed at the bottom of the site as ways to reach the team.

quotes: could you add a twitter/ X account and openchat account handles @ RadicalEconomist101  at the bottom which where people can reach us.

acceptanceCriteria: Footer displays two contact items labeled “X (Twitter): @RadicalEconomist101” and “OpenChat: @RadicalEconomist101”.
The handle text is clickable (links open in a new tab) and visually consistent with existing footer styling.
Footer still includes the existing copyright and caffeine.ai attribution.

requirements.text: Implement a customer service chat feature as an asynchronous support messaging system: visitors can submit questions, and an admin can reply; users can view replies to their own messages.

quotes: Also add a customer service chat where people can ask questions and I can answer them

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a public method to submit a support message without requiring authentication, storing message text plus timestamp and optional contact fields (e.g., display name and/or email).
Backend exposes an admin-only method to list support messages and post replies tied to a specific message/thread.

Backend exposes a method for a caller to list/view the messages and replies associated with their own submissions (if submitted while authenticated), and for guest submissions to be retrievable only via an admin view.
Frontend adds a “Customer Service Chat” entry point in the footer that opens a dialog/panel where a visitor can submit a question.
Frontend provides an admin UI (accessible from the existing Admin area and guarded by admin auth) to view incoming support messages and send replies.
Frontend provides an authenticated user view to see replies to their submitted messages (e.g., within the same dialog/panel when logged in).
If a user is not logged in, the UI clearly indicates they can still submit a question but that tracking replies is better when logged in (English text).
No WebSockets or real-time push behavior is required; updates can be polling or manual refresh via React Query refetch.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/immutablePaths (compose existing UI components instead).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add new support-chat logic there.
Do not implement real-time chat via WebSockets/push notifications; implement async messaging using standard canister calls and React Query refetch/polling.
nonGoals: Integrating third-party chat providers or messaging services.
Publicly exposing all support messages to all users (admin should see all; users should only see their own, when applicable).
